alert.note: Alert for Uinta (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 02 at 3:46AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...RISES TO CREEKS, STREAMS, AND RIVERS DUE TO INCREASED SNOWMELT... Streams, creeks, and rivers will continue to experience significant rises moving forward throughout the week, especially low and mid elevation watersheds across the forecast area. Waterways will be running high, fast, cold, and extremely dangerous increasing the risk of hypothermia and drowning with even brief periods of time in the water. Keep a safe distance from these waterways as banks may become unstable, and especially monitor children and pets closely as they can quickly drown in these elevated flows. Isolated flooding has occurred, and will continue to over the several days. Many other mid-elevation watersheds will continue to run high, fast, and cold with flows approaching, or remaining near, bankfull conditions. High pressure over the area will lead to continued temperatures around 10 to 20 degrees above normal through midweek. Given record snowpack in our area mountains, these temperatures will yield continued snowmelt of low and mid-elevation basins, leading to the high flows mentioned above. A low pressure system will move into the region and bring cooler temperatures from Thursday on into the weekend, resulting in decreased snowmelt. Continue to monitor conditions closely as the spring snowmelt- runoff has now begun in earnest. Stay tuned for the latest river forecasts, watches, and warnings. Refer to those already issued for additional information.
